results.content: I built a tetris game in a handful of hours which was fun! But moved to fast and the screen was hard to read.
results.content_html: I built a tetris game in a handful of hours which was fun! But moved to fast and the screen was hard to read.

results.content: As an introduction to graphics programming in javascript this tutorial is very good.  I would recommend this tutorial.
results.content_html: As an introduction to graphics programming in javascript this tutorial is very good. I would recommend this tutorial.

results.content:
Source code is very basic, not well organized (no classes/abstractions, just functions in root scope) and can be imporved in many cases, but it is working, it gives clear understanding of basic game mechanics.

I want to point out that it is very annoying to watch video in 720p quality when author used screen with resolution of 1080p. At least should have been applied zoom in author code editor.

Very strange usage of multiple if...else statements. Isn't it obviouse that for such cases it is more suitable to use switch...case statement?

Also author used not very reliable (crossbrowser) and readable event.keyCode when there is available unified event.code. Instead of operating some meaningless numbers it isbetter to use meaningfull values like ArrowDown, Space, KeyD etc.

I didn't like algorithm looking for correct shift of the figure when rotation action is called. But for this course it is perfectly siutable, diving deeper in to some more advanced calculations would be too much.

Anyway I want to thank author for his work. It is still great, simple and clear, it gave me almost everything I wanted to know. I beleive this course is great for the introduction to web game development.
results.content_html:
Source code is very basic, not well organized (no classes/abstractions, just functions in root scope) and can be imporved in many cases, but it is working, it gives clear understanding of basic game mechanics.

I want to point out that it is very annoying to watch video in 720p quality when author used screen with resolution of 1080p. At least should have been applied zoom in author code editor.

Very strange usage of multiple if...else statements. Isn't it obviouse that for such cases it is more suitable to use switch...case statement?

Also author used not very reliable (crossbrowser) and readable event.keyCode when there is available unified event.code. Instead of operating some meaningless numbers it isbetter to use meaningfull values like ArrowDown, Space, KeyD etc.

I didn't like algorithm looking for correct shift of the figure when rotation action is called. But for this course it is perfectly siutable, diving deeper in to some more advanced calculations would be too much.

Anyway I want to thank author for his work. It is still great, simple and clear, it gave me almost everything I wanted to know. I beleive this course is great for the introduction to web game development.
